Description: Plaster cast of stele of Piankhy.
Cultures/periods: Nubia and Sudan periods and cultures (original)
Curator's comments: The Piankhy stela was found in the Temple of Amun at Jebel Barkal and details a military campaign of Piye or Piankhy, first king of the 25th dynasty, against Lower Egypt. The original is now in the Cairo Museum. The Piankhy stela cast was purchased together with casts of several other objects from the Cairo Museum in 1891 by the then-Keeper of Egyptian and Assyrian Antiquities at the British Museum, E. A. Wallis Budge. Budge's archive papers (AES Ar.603) provide a list of the casts obtained from the Cairo Museum. In a letter dated 8 April 1891, German Egyptologist E. Brugsch notes that the casts are all finished and packed and will be forwarded the next day. The Piankhy stela cast was registered in the British Museum on 14 October 1893 along with the other Cairo casts. Published: Regulski, I. (ed.), 2022. Hieroglyphs: unlocking ancient Egypt, p. 153-4 Rondot, V. (ed.), 2022. Pharaon des Deux Terres: l'épopée africaine des rois de Napata, pp. 20-22
Exhibition history: 2022 27 April – 25 July, Paris, Musée du Louvre, Pharaoh of the Two Lands 2022-2023 13 Oct-19 Feb, London, BM, Hieroglyphs: unlocking ancient Egypt
Acquisition name: Donated by: Government of the British Protectorate of Egypt
